resources.string: Abhivyanjana@2015
SANAM PURI
Settings

\nAbhivyanjana is the annual techn-o-cultural fest of the Gautam Buddha University. Every year Abhivyanjana is held for a span of two days. The two days are packed with various cultural and technical events.
It is an interactive ground for the dynamic youth.Every year, students from Gautam Buddha University attend this technical extravaganza, in an atmosphere which makes them learn and unlearn through an application-oriented approach. It acts as a platform for them to showcase their technological and engineering prowess and nourishes growing scientific talent.
Students get together to celebrate the spirit of life by participating in various cultural, technical and social events in various dimensions of performing arts. There are solo and group performances like Music (Instrumental and Vocal), Dancing, Painting, Collage Making, Paper Presentation, Debate, Model Making, Robotic Competition, Skits, Drama, etc.

string.name: scavenger

SCAVENGER HUNT
 


Time:02:00 p.m. to 03:30 p.m. on February 13th , 2015
 


Venue:Sarovar
 

DESCRIPTION
 A scavenger hunt is a game in which the organizers prepare a list defining specific items, which the participants , individuals or teams , seek to gather all items on the list, usually without purchasing them ,or perform tasks or take photographs of the items, as specified. The goal is usually to be the first to complete the list, although in a variation on the game players can also be challenged to complete the tasks on the list in the most creative manner.

string.name: circiutmania
string.b:
Circuit Mania
 


Time : 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 


Venue : Electronics Lab, SOICT
 

DESCRIPTION
 • In this world of everlasting competition, Take your knowledge about electronics in your mind also in your hand and show your electronics skills. The students are provided with complex circuits and some optimized amount of related components from which they have to reduce down the circuit to optimized level and then have to patch the circuit with those components on the breadboard in the given period of time.

This event will be conducted in 2 rounds and all the rounds are related to circuit designing on Breadboard/PCB. This impromptu circuit design competition requires the participants to design a specific electronic and electrical application by using the components provided by us.



Guidelines:

1. Phase I (Elimination round) First round will begin with MCQ round in which participants will have to answer problems based on basic engineering questions. Selected participants will step into the next round. 
2. Phase II (Final round): 
In next round questions will be provided along with circuit components where participants will have to join the circuit correctly. All participants will also be asked to mount the circuit on breadboard.





CONTACT 
Deepak Bhati : deepakgbu1@gmail.com 9560617105

string.name: brainfreeze
string.b:
BRAIN FREEZE
 



Time : 2:00 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. on February 13th , 2015
 



Venue : SOE Lecture Room
 



DESCRIPTION
 
• Most of us have seen at least a single episode of Jeopardy on television. The format of Brain Freeze is similar in some ways, different in others. There is a host, but rather than three individual players there are five teams of two players each, in total ten players. Teams work together to answer the questions presented, pooling their knowledge base. If each team member comes up with a different answer, they must also be able to work together to choose which answer to submit. Like Jeopardy, there is also an element of wagering, as well as risk, based upon point values and confidence in a specific category. Brain Freeze is both strategy based and knowledge based, in other words.

Participants will have to pass several rounds which would include quiz( preliminary qualifying round),solve Rubik’s cube etc. Last 5 teams will battle it out in a final round to win the competition.



Team Specifications:

1. Max team size: 2 members

Time : 04:30 p.m. to 05:30 p.m. on February 13th , 2015
 



Venue : LH-102 , SOM
 


\DESCRIPTION
 
 • Introduction 
The aim of this event is to generate more awareness about the importance of knowing how to write professional letters, reports, slogans, etc. 
The event will be divided into three categories of sub-events: 
- Ad-Writing: where the students will be given a product for which they’ll have to frame a one/two-liner ad slogan. 
- Report Writing: a general topic will be given and the participants would have to write a professional report on it. 
- Response Letter Writing: a formal letter would have to be written on a topic given on the spot.

• Problem statement 
The writings should strictly be in a very formal/professional manner.

resources.string:
LITERARY WRITING
 



Time:01:00 p.m. to 02:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 



Venue:LH102 , SOM
 



DESCRIPTION
 
Introduction:- The mission of the literary writing is to encourage emerging writers and promote literary excellence through its competition structure. This event is divided into two subcategories:- 
a) STORY WRITING/NARRATION: Narration is story writing and then telling. In many ways it is the easiest kind of writing because it comes so naturally to most people. Practically everyone enjoys telling and hearing stories. Short stories, novels, personal narratives are all examples of narrative writing. 
b) LITERARY CRITISICM:- Literary criticism is an extension of the social activity of interpreting. One reader writes down his or her views on what a particular work of literature means so that others can respond to that interpretation. The critic’s specific purpose may be to make volume judgement on a work , to explain his or her interpretation of the work, or to provide other readers with relevant historical or biographical information . The critics general purpose is to enrich the reader’s understanding of the literary work. 
RULES and REGULATIONS 
1) Narration (Narrative Writing)-

• • 3000 words maximum, the title is not included in the word count 
• • Participants may be given a topic at the spot or can be free expression, to write a short story on it. 
• • Entries must be entirely the work of the entrant and by submitting you are confirming that the work is your own. Any evidence to the contrary will result in immediate disqualification. 
• • Participants are allotted 10 minutes to narrate their stories, but the narration is optional. 
• • Maximum no. of participants- 30 
• • Participants may write in either Hindi or English Language 
2) Literary Criticism-

• • Maximum 350-400 words on a short story/poetry/drama 
• • Participants are allotted 20 minutes 
• • Maximum no. of participants- 30 
Judging Criteria-

• I. Substance and originality 
• II. Clarity, Creativity and Practicality 
• III. Writing style, Composition and Organisation 
• IV. Language, Grammer and Presentation

string.name: linefollower
string.b:
LINE FOLLOWER
 


Time:11:00 a.m. to 01:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 


Venue:SOICT Backside
 


DESCRIPTION
 The Line follower robot is a mobile machine that can detect and follow the line drawn on the floor. Generally, the path is predefined and can be visible like a black line on a white surface with a high contrasted colour. Participants should have to complete the paths as per rules and regulation. Event is divided in two rounds. Participants who completed each round in less time with minimum faults will be declared as a winner. 
SPECFICATION 
Machine Specifications: 
• The Robot must be strictly autonomous. 
• The width of the black (no white line) will be less than 5cm 
• Dimensions of the Robot should be less than 20cm*20cm*20cm (l x b x h)
 • A power supply should be of maximum 12-15 V. 
Arena specifications: 
• The arena is made up on the white cartridge sheet with black line of around 2-3 cm . 
• The course line (turns) may have acute, obtuse and right angles curves 
• The schematic design of the arena will be shown to the participants a day before the event. 
RULES and REGULATIONS 
• The Robot has to follow the black line on white background and complete the track in least possible time. Maximum 3 touches will be allowed for each round. (each touch contains 5 sec penalty.) 
• Maximum Four Participants are allowed in a team. 
• Team members can be from different colleges. 
• If the machine remains immobile for respectable time then marking will be as per the judges discretion.




CONTACT 
Utkarsh Srivastava 11/IEC/117 +91-8826363547 srivastava92utkarsh@gmail.com

string.name: gamingfiesta
string.b:
GAMING FIESTA




Time : 08:00 a.m. to 01:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 



Venue : Computer Lab II , SOM
 


DESCRIPTION
 
• Gaming Fiesta is a gaming event in which participants will have a choice of two games:

• Counter Strike 1.6 
• Fifa 14 




Game Format: 
Competition Method: 5 vs. 5 
Players: 10 total (5 on each team) 
Rounds: 20 rounds for regulation play 
Max Rounds Format: 10 rounds as Offense, and 10 rounds as Defense per team until the victory condition is met 
Victory Condition: The first team to win 11 rounds in regulation. 
Buytime: 20 seconds 
Startmoney: $800 for regulation play 
Freezetime: 15 seconds 
 
Side Selection: 
 
• By knife round / coin toss 
 
There will be only one trophy for the teams winning 1st , 2nd and 3rd position . 
 
 
Fifa 14: 
All matches must be played in accordance with FIFA Laws of the Game, except as specifically modified as follows in the tournament rules: 
1. Game Mode 
The event will be a knockout tournament. 
For ease of use all games will be played in “Friendly” mode. After the game is finished, the computers will be guided back to the Home Screen and a new ‘Friendly” will be selected. 
2. Picking Teams 
Every player is allowed to pick their preferred team. Teams can be picked before the start of the game. Players are allowed to usemultiple teams throughout the tournament as they please. It is accepted to have the same teams play against each other (e.g.Barcelona vs Barcelona).In that case, the ‘away’ player will have to pick the Away Jersey for that team. In general, ‘away’ players are responsiblefor picking the jersey that does not resemble the home team jersey. 
3. Score Recording 
The scores will be reported to the score table by both players after the game. Marshalls will also record scores to make sure allscores are reported fairly. 
4. Game Length 
Prelim rounds will be of 2 X 4minute halves. 
Succeeding rounds will be of 2 X 5minute halves. 
The final round will be of 2X6 minutes.

There will be no more than 45 seconds for setting the starting line up and the half timechanges (45 seconds for each). Field marshals will check on the times and make sure the games are played fairly.




CONTACT 
Manas Malhotra (CS) : manas_12rocks@yahoo.com 
8130934177 
Hriday Taneja (FIFA) : 8882074441

string.name: woodencar
string.b:
WOODEN CAR
 


Time:02:00 p.m. to 03:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 


Venue:Sarovar
 


DESCRIPTION
 
Welcome to the event SAE 2015 to spread your innovative ideas, way of presenting skills and mechanical skills. 
Imagination is not only the unique human capacity to envision that which is not, and, therefore, the foundation of all invention and innovation. In its arguably most transformative and revelatory capacity, it is the power that enables us to empathize with humans whose experiences we have never shared. So, warm up your body to show your mechanical skill and designing depth by making your own wooden car. 
From the moment "GO" begins the race and all throughout you keep dreaming of just one place, the finish line. Gripping the ground and raising the gear you keep moving but finally comes the fear and apart from winning you just don’t care. When your car hits the race let the track itself say, oh!! Here comes the one that shall show you the way. 
And yes, the winner takes it all, because we don’t believe in speed limits and restraint.

Divyank Dubey 
divyank98@gmail.com 8506949419

PALACE OF CARDS
 



Time:11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. on February 14th , 2015
 



Venue:SOE Backside
 


DESCRIPTION
 
A Palace of cards is a structure created by stacking playing cards on top of each other. This event is organized to provide the students a chance of facing the types of connections between the cards that is look like a truss structure. The structures created, using this method relies on nothing more than balance and friction in order to stay upright. Ideally, adhesives or other external connecting methods are not used. Your job is to represent the number of story by placing minimum cards together in a specific manner.

Credits: PARENTS ,TEACHERS and FRIENDS
 If the heavens were all parchment and the trees of the forest all pens,and every human being were a scribe,it would be impossible to record all that we have learned from our PARENTS,TEACHERS and FRIENDS
